tweets.text: @HelenVi00175623 @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe Using WHO guidelines for H2S is a smokescreen. It's impossible to measure with accuracy the effects of molecules of H2S on every adult and child for every minute of the day and night. The agencies need to act on the high volume of complaints and symptoms. That's the evidence.

@HelenVi00175623 @maricaoneill @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @pow_rebecca @transportgovuk @StaffordshireCC @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @StinkStopthe There are a couple of things for Newcastle Borough Council to answer. 

Firstly, when granting permission to fill, what final ground levels were proposed and accepted? Surely there is a Drawing with levels in the Councils possession? Has anybody from the Council made checks?

urls.title: Walleys Quarry ‚Äì Staffordshire Landfill
urls.description: Walleys Quarry offers customers a safe disposal method for waste that cannot be otherwise re-used or recycled. Our team of experts carefully manage and monitor the site through a set of tight controls and procedures to the highest standards and ensure compliance with all legal and governmental policies and regulations. We work to minimise any impact on the environment now and for the future of the site. The Walleys Quarry community fund has distributed over ¬£1.7m to community and environmental projects

'Shocking': Hazardous waste from sewage sludge used as fertiliser linked to catastrophic loss of dairy herd, and where's the @EnvAgency report on pollution and health risks from sewage sludge? https://t.co/J2R488jWuX via @theENDSReport

We want more transparency, more communication & don‚Äôt want to be treated as ignorant fools. It‚Äôs abundantly clear that it‚Äôs our health & environment that are at stake here #stopthestink @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/17d9FowMOP

I‚Äôd be very interested to know more about particulate matter in Newcastle under Lyme @DrMickSalt , is this something the @EnvAgency are looking into as part of their monitoring? #stopthestink https://t.co/HaGsRfkULC

@DrMickSalt @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids Medium term is 15-90 days and so should already have been applied from 11th March. We are now beyond 90 days of AQM and so presumably long term exposure durations, especially if you take into account increased complaints which began in December and so six months ago!

@BorisJohnson so how about telling @EnvAgency to get it‚Äôs house in order like you‚Äôve done to the bbc ? Better still tell them to get this sorted in Newcastle under Lyme or aren‚Äôt we worth the PR @StinkStopthe

tweets.text:
Ahead of #WorldOceanDay, we've developed an interactive tool for primary and secondary school students to show how plastic pollution travels to the ocean.

If you're a teacher, parent or guardian, read more here:
https://t.co/YvPDT5eR45 

@Plastic_EU #STEMEducation https://t.co/aU627GeQJx

urls.title: Environment Agency launches educational tools for WOD to ‚Äòhelp marine life thrive‚Äô - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Schools across England will mark World Ocean Day (WOD) next month (Tuesday, June 8) by exploring the journey of plastic with the Environment Agency. Primary and secondary schools are invited to view a series of online films and activities via an interactive map in advance of the event, culminating in a live question and answer sessio n with Environment Agency and World Wildlife Fund experts on the actual day. By clicking on different points of the map, students can learn how plastic pollution travels

tweets.text: @markday331 @EmmaHowardBoyd @Ofwat @OfwatChair @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA The way the legislation is written means that rivers can only currently be designated when they meet the criteria for the level of use by people for bathing activities- @CleanIlkley paved the way for this to be considered for every river used in this way https://t.co/v2SfY0C7YX

urls.title: Bathing waters: apply for designation or de-designation
urls.description: How to apply for a beach or inland water to be officially identified as a bathing water, or to remove the designation from an existing bathing water.

tweets.text: This is the point many of us are trying to make to @EnvAgencyMids and @PHE_uk exposure is not just low and very occasional it's moderate (or high occasionally!) and prolonged. Usually WAY above "nuisance" levels for hours or days every week. #stopthestink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/NPCbuhl2PO

tweets.text: We have reviewed the application to the @EnvAgency for tunnel approval. The document and the supporting reports are missing critical borehole logs and reports around the sensitive R Misbourne crossing locations at Chalfont St Giles and Shardeloes Lake. Why????

@EnvAgencyAnglia @huntsdc @stneotscouncil This work is actually acting to impede river health and reduce biodiversity. For example, fallen branches are also known as snags and are important for controlling river flow rate and preventing flooding downstream.
How to stop a river from recovering. Just rip out the habitat & wait. Then when more wild habitat starts to develop again just rip it out again. https://t.co/bGQ14DHIj5
